required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of the TITAN™ Total Shoulder System
clinical_study.official_title: A Post-Market Observational Study to Evaluate Performance and Safety of the TITAN™ Total Shoulder System

brief_summary.textblock: A post market, non-randomized, multi-center, open-label,clinical study using survivorship to study the safety and efficacy of the Integra® TITAN™ Total Shoulder System 1.0 (TAS) when used for total shoulder arthroplasty.

detailed_description.textblock: Observational, multi-center, post-market study to provide data on the performance and safety of the TITAN™ Total Shoulder System. The study will enroll patients that underwent total shoulder arthroplasty with the TITAN™ Total Shoulder System per standard of care less than 5 years ago. Available retrospective data up to the 2-year time point will be collected, per the study protocol, from medical record reviews. Prospective observational data will be collected from the time of patient enrollment during the following postoperative clinical visits: 1 year, 2 years, 5 years and 10 years post-surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Implant survivorship is defined as absence of device removal or revision of one or more of the implant component(s).

secondary_outcome.description: Implant survivorship is defined as absence of device removal or revision of one or more of the implant component(s).

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change of Range of Motion (ROM) compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change of Range of Motion (ROM) compared to baseline
Radiographic assessment for loosening, malpositioned implant, subsidence, subluxation, and radiolucency

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change in Quality Of Life (EQ-5D) compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change in Quality Of Life (EQ-5D) compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change of American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeon Score (ASES) compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change of American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeon Score (ASES) compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change of PENN Pain and Function Score (PENN) compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change of PENN Pain and Function Score (PENN) compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change in Quality Of Life (SF-12V1) compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Relative change in Quality Of Life (SF-12V1) compared to baseline

clinical_study.condition: Post-traumatic Arthrosis of Other Joints, Shoulder Region
Rotator Cuff Syndrome of Shoulder and Allied Disorders

arm_group.description: Integra TITAN™ Total Shoulder System Generation 1.0

study_pop.textblock: Subject has undergone shoulder arthroplasty with the first generation TITAN Total Shoulder System with implantation between June 2012 and June 2015

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject has undergone shoulder arthroplasty with the first generation TITAN Total Shoulder System with implantation between June 2012 and June 2015.
2. The first generation TITAN Total Shoulder System is still intact and the subject has not received any revision surgeries involving the TITAN Total Shoulder System.
3. Subject is willing and able to participate in required follow-up visits at the investigational site and to complete study procedures.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject, in the opinion of the PI, has an emotional or neurological condition that would pre-empt their ability or willingness to participate in the study such as mental illness, or drug or alcohol abuse.
2. Subject is known to be at risk for lost to follow-up, or failure to return for scheduled visits.
